title: How to perform a contour integral plot requisite (tikz pgf, pgfplots, contour, tex) - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for asking the question. In order to be certain that I address the question, I’ll give you two answers. On Quora you can denote a contour integral symbolically as: \displaystyle \oint_{\Gamma} f(z) \; \mathrm dz Which looks like:  However, the part that interests me, is how to draw the contour in a nice way. In order to do that using  you’ll need to use a library. I don’t know whether that’s allowed considering the limited set of commands we may apply on Quora. But any TexEditor would allow it. You could copy the result as an image for use with Quora, or use it directly in your (La)Tex-document and/or convert it to a pdf. I browsed and found the following link, which explains a few tricks, in order to facilitate the process: Draw the dogbone contour for complex integral Have a look! I’ll definitely will give it a go.
